name: "Crocodile on the Sandbank" Quiz | Authors | 10 Questions

questions.text: When Amelia goes to Rome, she meets a girl whom she hires as a companion, named Evelyn. What is Evelyn's last name?
questions.explanation:
Barton-Forbes.

	Evelyn fainted in the streets from hunger, so Amelia took her in and hired her as a companion to travel with her.

questions.text: What is the name of the houseboat that Amelia and Evelyn rent in Egypt?
questions.explanation:
Philae.

	They rent it, intending to live on it for four months. The captain of the boat is Reis Hassan.

questions.text: Who is the French director of antiquities?
questions.explanation:
M. Maspero

	The museum where he works is very disorganized, and Amelia actually dusts a very old, fragile Egyptian antique.

questions.text: What are the names of the brothers that Amelia and Evelyn meet at the museum?
questions.explanation:
Radcliffe and Walter Emerson.

	Radcliffe (or Emerson, as he is referred to through most of the book) is very rude, arrogant, and tactless. His brother, who almost immediately falls in love with Evelyn, is the opposite. He is handsome, polite, and very gallant.

questions.text: Who meets up with Evelyn in Egypt and proposes to her?
questions.explanation:
Lucas.

	Lucas, who is a distant cousin of Evelyn, says that he has inherited his grandfather's fortune, and is willing to marry Evelyn so that they can share it. But unbeknownst to Evelyn, their grandfather has really left his fortune to her, and Lucas only wants to marry her so that he can get his hands on her money.

questions.text: What apparition do Amelia, Evelyn, Walter, and Emerson see every night during their stay near the royal tomb?
questions.explanation:
Mummy & a mummy.

	The mummy turns out to be Alberto, with whom Evelyn had had an affair a while ago. He is in cahoots with Lucas, whose real name is Luigi, so that they can get her money.

questions.correct: Some ancient Egyptian pavement that Emerson had dug up
options: All of the antiquities at the museum
The mummified body of a cow that Walter found
questions.explanation:
Some ancient Egyptian pavement that Emerson had dug up.

	Fortunately, Evelyn had just finished doing a painting of it, so at least its image was preserved.

questions.text: Evelyn admits to Amelia that she loves Walter. Why does she think that he won't want to marry her?
options: She's already had an affair with another guy
His brother wants him to marry well
questions.explanation:
All of these.

	Amelia: "Accept Lucas's offer. No, no, I mean his offer of money. Half of your grandfather's fortune is yours, morally. If you really believe Walter would accept--"Evelyn: "Amelia, that is not worthy of you. Could I accept Lucas's generosity and use it to buy the affection of Lucas's rival?"Amelia: "You put things in such a cold-blooded way."

questions.text: What does the very rude Emerson call Amelia all the time?
questions.explanation:
Peabody.

	Emerson: "Wake up, Peabody! If you fall asleep, I shall slap you till you howl."

questions.text: Who marries whom in the end?
questions.correct: Evelyn marries Walter, and Amelia marries Emerson
options: Evelyn marries Lucas, and Amelia doesn't get married
Evelyn marries Emerson, and Amelia marries Walter
Amelia marries Lucas, and Evelyn marries Alberto
questions.explanation:
Evelyn marries Walter, and Amelia marries Emerson.

	Surprise, surprise! Although Emerson acts like he hates Amelia through the entire book, he says in the end that this was because he didn't think he'd ever be able to marry her, and he was picturing life without her. Very romantic. Thanks for playing my quiz. :-)
